qas.question: What did the pope suffer on 25 May 1963?
Who broke the news to John XXIII about his cancer?
When was it clear that the cancer had overcome the resistance of John XXIII?
What did Loris F. Capovilla suffer from on May 25, 1963?
What treatment did she require on May 25, 1963?

plausible_answers.text: the cancer had perforated the stomach wall

qas.question: What had happened to the cancer Loris F. Capovilla was suffering from?
What could be done to help Loris's condition?
When was it clear that Loris was loosing her battle with stomach cancer?

context: On 25 May 1963, the pope suffered <b3_0>another <a0_0>haemorrhage<b3_0/><a0_0/> and required <b4_0>several blood transfusions<b4_0/>, but <b5_0>the cancer had perforated the stomach wall<b5_0/> and peritonitis soon set in. The doctors conferred in a decision regarding this matter and John XXIII's aide <a1_0>Loris F. Capovilla<a1_0/> broke the news to him saying that the cancer had done its work and <b6_0>nothing could be done<b6_0/> for him. Around this time, his remaining siblings arrived to be with him. <b7_0>By <a2_0>31 May<b7_0/><a2_0/>, it had become clear that the cancer had overcome the resistance of John XXIII – it had left him confined to his bed.
